title: Joseph Pemberton
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers)**

Joe Pemberton is a graphic designer and a founding partner of [San Francisco](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/San%20Francisco)-based interface design firm, [Punchcut](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Punchcut). Prior to founding Punchcut in 2002, Joe and [Jared Benson](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jared%20Benson) partnered on the development of [Typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typophile). Joe was a creative director for Razorfish (in the [New York](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/New%20York) and San Francisco offices) and also at the New York advertising agency, Merkeley Newman Harty where, among other projects, he designed the JetBlue Airways identity and livery system.

In the past Joe Pemberton provided art direction for the [FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontShop) publication _[Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Font_Magazine)_ and juried the design competition for the 2007 [STEP Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/wiki/STEP%20Magazine) "Best of Web" issue.

Typophile user profile: [http://typophile.com/user/1160](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/typophile.com/user/1160 "http://typophile.com/user/1160")  
Personal web site: [http://josephpemberton.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423064213/http:/josephpemberton.com/ "http://josephpemberton.com")
author: test
